entry.title: Veteran Trader Champions Bitcoin, Says US Dollar ‚ÄòIs Being Destroyed‚Äô
entry.summary:
A veteran trader has projected a major drop in US dollar value ‚Äì and the strong ascent of Bitcoin. Peter Brandt‚Äôs comments coincide with a period when financial accountability of the US government is under extreme examination.
Brandt‚Äôs prediction fits a general view among financial experts concerned about the long-term survival of paper money. Based on his analysis, Brandt said the decline of the greenback is an indication of more fundamental economic problems that may affect its valuation. He specifically said the US dollar is ‚Äúbeing destroyed, and that all paper currencies for that matter ‚Äúare being destroyed‚Äù as well.
U.S. Dollar is being destroyed. All paper currencies are being destroyed. An entirely new system of payments and store of value will evolve during next decade. D‚Ä¶

entry.title: 6 Reasons Why The XRP Price ‚ÄòWill Pump‚Äô: Crypto Pundit
entry.summary:
In a new YouTube video, crypto pundit Zach Rector outlined his bullish stance on XRP, providing six reasons he believes will catalyze a significant price increase for the cryptocurrency. Rector‚Äôs insights come at a pivotal time for the crypto asset and Ripple.
#1 Resolution Of The XRP Lawsuit
Zach Rector pointed to the imminent conclusion of a prolonged lawsuit between Ripple Labs and the US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC), which has extended over three and a half years. He highlighted, ‚ÄúYou better be ready for this one because you saw what happened last year with Judge Torres ruling on XRP. We shot up and basically shut down all of the exchanges.‚Äù
The potential resolution of this legal battle could be a major driver for market dynamics, possibly relieving legal pressures an‚Ä¶

entry.title: Alby Opens Waitlist For Alby Hub: A One-Click Lightning Node
entry.summary: Alby is officially launching the waitlist for their new product, Alby Hub. The Hub is a one-click install Lightning Node application that aims to make self-custodial Lightning use as painless as possible. Users can sign up to join the waitlist here. Alby Hub integrates a one click Lightning node, a self-custodial Lightning wallet, and an app store that enables easy connection between a user‚Äôs Lightning wallet and other applications such as Damus, Stacker News, podcast apps, and external Lightning wallets to control their nodes with. Easy migration from Alby‚Äôs web wallet to Alby Hub is supported. There will also be an Alby Hub Cloud plan for 21k satoshis a month to easily spin up an Alby Hub instance run in the Alby Cloud. The plan includes live channel management support and setup support, and access to the Alby Buzz community. Alby Hub will also be made available as a DIY tool to install on your own desktop or server. It will even be possible to run on a Raspberry Pi Zero. Alby Hub was developed to remove the friction in running your own self-custodial Lightning Node. Given the dominance of custodial Lightning solutions in the space currently, the goal of Alby Hub is to make it as painless as possible for users to manage their own Lightning funds in a self custodial environment, making them a truly sovereign Lightning user. Michael Bumann, the founder of Alby, had this to say: ‚ÄúAt Alby, we always focused on building tools and protocols to natively use the Lightning Network on the web like the Alby Extension, which changed the way Lightning is used in web browsers. With Alby Hub, we are now taking Lightning Network self-custody to the next level by rethinking the utility behind running a lightning node. What does a node and wallet look like that can integrate with any bitcoin-powered app with just a few clicks? With Alby Hub, users now have endless possibilities for self-sovereign payments on the web without the technical overhead.‚Äù Join the waitlist here now.

entry.title: Bitcoin Is Cash For The Internet
entry.summary: Bitcoin is much more than a typical online payment system. After all, we have plenty of those: PayPal, Venmo, and the like. Bitcoin and other privately used cryptocurrencies are cash for the internet. Paper cash is an almost perfect way to pay someone. You don‚Äôt need an account. It doesn‚Äôt care who you are or what you‚Äôre buying. It‚Äôs a bearer instrument. I hand you a dollar. Now you have the dollar and I don‚Äôt. It‚Äôs instant and no one can interfere with the transaction. There is no trusting someone else to make sure the dollar gets to you. And best of all, it‚Äôs private. There is no record of that transaction whatsoever. It‚Äôs so private that there is an old joke in the cryptocurrency community: If cash were to be invented today, it would be illegal. For all its benefits, however, paper ca‚Ä¶

entry.title: Ferrari To Accept Bitcoin and Crypto Payments In Europe
entry.summary:
Luxury sports car manufacturer Ferrari announced it will expand the ability to pay with Bitcoin and crypto to its European dealerships starting this month. The move comes after Ferrari first began accepting Bitcoin and crypto payments at its US dealers last year.
JUST IN: Luxury Cars Manufacturer Ferrari to accept #Bitcoin and crypto payments in Europe. pic.twitter.com/PxT7Z7OwbP ‚Äî Bitcoin Magazine (@BitcoinMagazine) July 24, 2024
Ferrari said the rollout to Europe will occur by the end of July, enabling customers to purchase new vehicles using Bitcoin and crypto. The company plans to expand the Bitcoin payment option to dealers worldwide by the end of 2024, where legally permitted. Ferrari continues its partnership with leading Bitcoin payments processor BitPay to process the payments. When a purchase is made in Bitcoin, BitPay instantly converts it to traditional fiat currency for Ferrari's dealers to remove exposure to Bitcoin and crypto volatility. The ability to pay with Bitcoin and other crypto caters to Ferrari's tech-savvy customer base with sizeable Bitcoin wealth. It also taps into growing mainstream adoption, as more major companies accept Bitcoin payments including Microsoft, AT&T, and travel site Expedia. Ferrari said accepting Bitcoin and crypto provides customers with additional flexibility and convenience in purchasing the company's luxury vehicles. The automaker saw strong demand after enabling Bitcoin payments in the US last year. As luxury and high-end brands adopt Bitcoin payments, it helps legitimize the asset class as a currency and not just an investment. The ability of consumers to spend Bitcoin at more retailers was also cited as a factor in the recent Bitcoin market rally.

entry.title: ProtonMail Maker Proton Is Launching Its Own Bitcoin Wallet
entry.summary: Proton, the Swiss technology company that creates privacy-preserving online tools like ProtonMail and ProtonVPN, is launching Proton Wallet, a self-custody Bitcoin wallet. This new product will be integrated with ProtonMail and will enable users to send bitcoin as easily as sending an email. ‚ÄúBitcoin‚Äôs value to society has been hindered by the difficulty of transacting and security concerns, and we designed Proton Wallet to specifically address both,‚Äù said Andy Yen, founder and CEO of Proton in a press release shared with Bitcoin Magazine. ‚ÄúProton Wallet‚Äôs ability to support Bitcoin via email now makes Bitcoin transactions as easy to use as PayPal, while preserving the decentralized and non-custodial nature of Bitcoin.‚Äù Proton Wallet is the latest in its suite of end-to-end encrypted tools‚Ä¶

Michael Dell calls Fink video ‚Äòfascinating‚Äô. Fear & Greed index shifts to Greed. Tether mints $1bn USDT on Tron. Stripe expands crypto integration to the EU.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 158 - A WILD WEEKEND FOR BITCOIN
entry.summary: Trump response optimism takes BTC to $63K. Bitcoin whales accumulate most since April 2023. Trump still set to talk at Bitcoin Nashville. ETH ETF approval this week: Geraci. XRP vs SEC press conference rumoured on 18th. Crypto funds saw $1.44B inflows last week. Rumours China is to ‚Äòunban BTC‚Äô in Q4. S. Korea may delay crypto taxes until 2028. Russia to allow crypto trading on stock exchange. All altcoin categories outperform BTC over 7d. BitConnect infamous promoter convicted. Scroll becomes 8th L2 with TVL over $1bn. ETHFI Season 2 claims available this week. Base hits record 1m UserOps in a week.

entry.title: Zoltan Istvan on AI and Human Immortality
entry.summary: Transhumanist Party founder Zoltan Istvan chats with Decrypt's Emerging Technology report Jason Nelson about his journey with transhumanism, running for office, and why he fears AI is outpacing life science and poses a threat to the quest for immortality.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 157 - ROLLBIT FRIDAY!
entry.summary: The German state sells $2bn+ BTC and has under $300m left. BTC ETF sees $800M of inflows, Mr 100 keeps buying. SOL ETF deadline set for 2025, election could be key. SOL stablecoin TVL soars on Tether & PYUSD growth. Firedancer sees the first accepted block on SOL testnet. ETH ETFs finally expected next week. Monthly active crypto addresses top 100m. Trump to speak at Bitcoin Nashville conference. Golman Sachs to launch 3 tokenization projects. Short squeeze in altcoins sees TIA rise 80% from lows. MOG leads top memes coins, BONK flips WIF. Farming interest shifts to Berachain & Monad.

entry.title: What's the Meta? Meet the Solana Dev Who Suffered Third Degree Burns to Pump a Token
entry.summary:
Meet Mikol: the Dare dev that doused himself in isopropyl alcohol and had fireworks shot at him. He instantly went up in flames and was rushed to hospital, where it became apparent he suffered third degree burns.
In this episode, Mikol reflects on the biggest night of his life, details his injuries, and the grueling recovery process he‚Äôs still in. Despite the traumatic incident, Mikol isn‚Äôt done with the project. Instead, he‚Äôs planning to build a decentralized app where community members can take on dares in exchange for DARE tokens.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 156 - ETH ON THE RISE!
entry.summary: BTC ETF Flows: +$147m. ETH outperforms with ETF optimism. Germany government moves 2375 BTC again. Tether mints another $250m USDT on SOL. Trump to speak at Bitcoin Nashville. Goldman Sachs to launch 3 tokenisation projects. Realised losses similar to COVID period. Staked ETH nears ATH. CEX stablecoin volume hits 7-month low. CFTC says 70-80% of crypto not securities. Base hardfork improves compression 20-30%. BitMEX pleads guilty to AML violation. APTOS & SEI see weak attendance at ETHcc event.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 155 - ETFs SAVE THE DAY

SOL Firedancer sees first accepted block on testnet. Tether mints another $250m USDT on SOL. Crypto monthly active addresses tops 100m. Biden crypto veto now expected to be upheld. Tech coalition urges Biden to back crypto. People face security threats at ETHCC. DBS sees 300% growth in crypto trading. PYUSD now 7th largest stable coin. China may have already sold BTC holdings. TIA rises 80% from lows on short squeeze. TON to release L2 based on Polygon‚Äôs tech stack.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 154 - THE CELEBS ARE BACK...
entry.summary: BTC ETF Flows: +$295m. ETF inflows fight German selling, BTC unchanged. German government sells $900m BTC, moves more. Rate of sales implies German supply sold this week. ETH ETFs set to launch next week. Election may affect SOL ETF decision March 2025. Raydium beats ETH for 24hr fees. BTC ‚Äòpower law‚Äô points to 300% gain by 2025. BTC in 80 day post-halving re-accumulation phase. BlackRock treasury fund hits $500m. Republicans release pro-crypto policy. Senate urges blockchain tests for national security. Drop in BTC mining difficulty ‚Äòcomparable to FTX‚Äô. MetaMask introduces delegation toolkit. 25 major projects to launch tokens in H2 2025.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 153 - A WEAK WEEKEND
entry.summary: BTC sinks 5% then bounces back to unchanged. $58-60k the main area for ‚Äòshorts to defend‚Äô. Crypto funds saw $441m inflows last week. German government transfers 1000 BTC to sell. Crypto sentiment at lowest in over a year. ETH spot premium hits local highs. Japanese firm Metaplanet buys $2.5m BTC. Expect more miners merging: TeraWulf CEO. SOL Firedancer bug bounty goes live. GLM transfers $117m of ETH treasury to exchanges. 98% of coins have topped this cycle: Kang. ETH ETF should come in next 2 weeks: Geraci. Crypto progress disheartening: Copeland.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 152 - JOINED BY DEEZE!
entry.summary: BTC hits $54k, set for worst week in over year. Mt. Gox begins to move BTC & make distributions. German government continues to sell holdings. Worst day for BTC liquidations since FTX. Justin Sun says he is willing to buy German BTC. German MP calls on it to stop selling BTC. $52k super-trend support line eyed for BTC. Funding rates turn extremely negative across majors. Only 6 mining machines profitable below $56k. Coinbase spot buyers emerge to counter drop. Total3 hits RSI lows only hit 4 times in last 4 years. Fear & Greed index hits lowest since Jan 2023. Capo remains bullish. Real selling begins at $38k: Schiff. Coinbase continue to fight for Gensler‚Äôs emails. Circle mints $250m USDC on SOL. Symbiotic hits $1bn TVL. Taiwan Mobile may open crypto exchange. Unisat completes funding round with Binance.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 151 - BTC TAPS THE 60K LINE
entry.summary: BTC ETF Flows: -$14m. BTC drops to $60k, CME gap filed again. $1bn shorts liquidated if we rally to $62.6k. Pump(.)fun surpasses ETH for revenue. ETH will outperform BTC after ETF launch: K33. ETH ETF may be delayed even further. BTC heading to $150k: Fundstrat. Chainlink & Fidelity partner for fund data on-chain. entry.title: FOMO HOUR 150 - BILLY TO A BILLY?

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 149 - LUCA NETZ LIVE!
entry.summary: BTC bounces back above $61k after nosedive. SOL leads majors, BTC dominance falls. BTC RSI hit 18, largest net selling day in over a year. $174m ETF outflow led by GBTC. German government sells $24m more more BTC. Mt Gox info probably ‚Äòleaked to insiders‚Äô. Mr 100 buys dip for first time in 34 days. SOL leads Moonpay transactions for 5th week.
